channel.title: iDigital
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from iDigital, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Is the stock market open tomorrow for Labor Day? Does the post office deliver mail?
item.description: The end-of-summer holiday is upon us, so be prepared for plenty of closings.

item.title: ‘I’m asking for a friend’: Will the IRS write off $60,000 lost in a romance phishing scam?
item.description: “The bank did try to stop them from executing the transfers.”

item.title: My friend, 61, signed a $20K contract for dental implants. She can’t afford it. Can she fight it?
item.description: “After her room and board is paid at the assisted-living home, she has $9,000 left for the year.”

item.title: We’re in our 70s and have $1.4 million. We pay $1,750 in rent. Will we run out of money in retirement?
item.description: “Our adjusted gross income was $160,000 last year. We both also have fairly good health insurance..”

item.title: I am a 65-year-old single woman with 25 credit cards. How do I cancel them without hurting my credit score?
item.description: “I pay them off each month if I use them and don’t run a balance.”

item.title: Software commands 40% of cybersecurity budgets as gen AI attacks execute in milliseconds
item.description: Software spending now makes up 40% of cybersecurity budgets, with investment expected to grow as CISOs prioritize real-time AI defenses.

item.title: How Sakana AI’s new evolutionary algorithm builds powerful AI models without expensive retraining
item.description: M2N2 is a model merging technique that creates powerful multi-skilled agents without the high cost and data needs of retraining.

item.title: RealMan launches robotics data training center in Beijing

item.title: In crowded voice AI market, OpenAI bets on instruction-following and expressive speech to win enterprise adoption
item.description: OpenAI's new speech model, gpt-realtime, hopes that its more naturalistic voices would make enterprises use more AI generated voices in applications.

item.title: Tessa Lau to speak at RoboBusiness’ Women in Robotics Lunch
